AddLayerVersionPermission.description: The following example grants permission for the account 223456789012 to use version 1 of a layer named my-layer.
AddLayerVersionPermission.title: To add permissions to a layer version

AddPermission.description: The following example adds permission for Amazon S3 to invoke a Lambda function named my-function for notifications from a bucket named my-bucket-1xpuxmplzrlbh in account 123456789012.
AddPermission.title: To grant Amazon S3 permission to invoke a function

AddPermission.description: The following example adds permission for account 223456789012 invoke a Lambda function named my-function.
AddPermission.title: To grant another account permission to invoke a function

CreateAlias.description: The following example creates an alias named LIVE that points to version 1 of the my-function Lambda function.

input.Description: alias for live version of function
input.Name: LIVE

output.Description: alias for live version of function
output.Name: LIVE

CreateAlias.title: To create an alias for a Lambda function

CreateEventSourceMapping.description: The following example creates a mapping between an SQS queue and the my-function Lambda function.
CreateEventSourceMapping.title: To create a mapping between an event source and an AWS Lambda function

CreateFunction.description: The following example creates a function with a deployment package in Amazon S3 and enables X-Ray tracing and environment variable encryption.

input.Description: Process image objects from Amazon S3.

output.Description: Process image objects from Amazon S3.

CreateFunction.title: To create a function

DeleteAlias.description: The following example deletes an alias named BLUE from a function named my-function
DeleteAlias.title: To delete a Lambda function alias

DeleteEventSourceMapping.description: The following example deletes an event source mapping. To get a mapping's UUID, use ListEventSourceMappings.
DeleteEventSourceMapping.title: To delete a Lambda function event source mapping

DeleteFunction.description: The following example deletes version 1 of a Lambda function named my-function.
DeleteFunction.title: To delete a version of a Lambda function

DeleteFunctionConcurrency.description: The following example deletes the reserved concurrent execution limit from a function named my-function.
DeleteFunctionConcurrency.title: To remove the reserved concurrent execution limit from a function

DeleteFunctionEventInvokeConfig.description: The following example deletes the asynchronous invocation configuration for the GREEN alias of a function named my-function.
DeleteFunctionEventInvokeConfig.title: To delete an asynchronous invocation configuration

DeleteLayerVersion.description: The following example deletes version 2 of a layer named my-layer.
DeleteLayerVersion.title: To delete a version of a Lambda layer

DeleteProvisionedConcurrencyConfig.description: The following example deletes the provisioned concurrency configuration for the GREEN alias of a function named my-function.
DeleteProvisionedConcurrencyConfig.title: To delete a provisioned concurrency configuration

GetAccountSettings.description: This operation takes no parameters and returns details about storage and concurrency quotas in the current Region.
GetAccountSettings.title: To get account settings

GetAlias.description: The following example returns details about an alias named BLUE for a function named my-function
GetAlias.title: To get a Lambda function alias

GetEventSourceMapping.description: The following example returns details about an event source mapping. To get a mapping's UUID, use ListEventSourceMappings.
GetEventSourceMapping.title: To get a Lambda function's event source mapping

GetFunction.description: The following example returns code and configuration details for version 1 of a function named my-function.

Configuration.Description: Process image objects from Amazon S3.

GetFunction.title: To get a Lambda function

GetFunctionConcurrency.description: The following example returns the reserved concurrency setting for a function named my-function.
GetFunctionConcurrency.title: To get the reserved concurrency setting for a function

GetFunctionConfiguration.description: The following example returns and configuration details for version 1 of a function named my-function.

output.Description: Process image objects from Amazon S3.

GetFunctionConfiguration.title: To get a Lambda function's event source mapping

GetFunctionEventInvokeConfig.description: The following example returns the asynchronous invocation configuration for the BLUE alias of a function named my-function.
GetFunctionEventInvokeConfig.title: To get an asynchronous invocation configuration

GetLayerVersion.description: The following example returns information for version 1 of a layer named my-layer.
GetLayerVersion.title: To get information about a Lambda layer version

GetLayerVersionByArn.description: The following example returns information about the layer version with the specified Amazon Resource Name (ARN).

output.Description: Dependencies for the blank-python sample app.

GetLayerVersionByArn.title: To get information about a Lambda layer version

GetPolicy.description: The following example returns the resource-based policy for version 1 of a Lambda function named my-function.
GetPolicy.title: To retrieve a Lambda function policy

GetProvisionedConcurrencyConfig.description: The following example returns details for the provisioned concurrency configuration for the BLUE alias of the specified function.
GetProvisionedConcurrencyConfig.title: To get a provisioned concurrency configuration

GetProvisionedConcurrencyConfig.description: The following example displays details for the provisioned concurrency configuration for the BLUE alias of the specified function.
GetProvisionedConcurrencyConfig.title: To view a provisioned concurrency configuration

Invoke.description: The following example invokes version 1 of a function named my-function with an empty event payload.
Invoke.title: To invoke a Lambda function

Invoke.description: The following example invokes version 1 of a function named my-function asynchronously.
Invoke.title: To invoke a Lambda function asynchronously

InvokeAsync.description: The following example invokes a Lambda function asynchronously
InvokeAsync.title: To invoke a Lambda function asynchronously

ListAliases.description: The following example returns a list of aliases for a function named my-function.
ListAliases.title: To list a function's aliases

ListEventSourceMappings.description: The following example returns a list of the event source mappings for a function named my-function.
ListEventSourceMappings.title: To list the event source mappings for a function

ListFunctionEventInvokeConfigs.description: The following example returns a list of asynchronous invocation configurations for a function named my-function.
ListFunctionEventInvokeConfigs.title: To view a list of asynchronous invocation configurations

ListFunctions.description: This operation returns a list of Lambda functions.
ListFunctions.title: To get a list of Lambda functions

ListLayerVersions.description: The following example displays information about the versions for the layer named blank-java-lib

LayerVersions.Description: Dependencies for the blank-java sample app.
Dependencies for the blank-java sample app.

ListLayerVersions.title: To list versions of a layer

ListLayers.description: The following example returns information about layers that are compatible with the Python 3.7 runtime.
ListLayers.title: To list the layers that are compatible with your function's runtime

ListProvisionedConcurrencyConfigs.description: The following example returns a list of provisioned concurrency configurations for a function named my-function.
ListProvisionedConcurrencyConfigs.title: To get a list of provisioned concurrency configurations

ListTags.description: The following example displays the tags attached to the my-function Lambda function.
ListTags.title: To retrieve the list of tags for a Lambda function

ListVersionsByFunction.description: The following example returns a list of versions of a function named my-function

Versions.Description: Process image objects from Amazon S3.
Process image objects from Amazon S3.

ListVersionsByFunction.title: To list versions of a function

PublishLayerVersion.description: The following example creates a new Python library layer version. The command retrieves the layer content a file named layer.zip in the specified S3 bucket.
PublishLayerVersion.title: To create a Lambda layer version

PublishVersion.description: This operation publishes a version of a Lambda function

output.Description: Process image objects from Amazon S3.

PublishVersion.title: To publish a version of a Lambda function

PutFunctionConcurrency.description: The following example configures 100 reserved concurrent executions for the my-function function.
PutFunctionConcurrency.title: To configure a reserved concurrency limit for a function

PutFunctionEventInvokeConfig.description: The following example sets a maximum event age of one hour and disables retries for the specified function.
PutFunctionEventInvokeConfig.title: To configure error handling for asynchronous invocation

PutProvisionedConcurrencyConfig.description: The following example allocates 100 provisioned concurrency for the BLUE alias of the specified function.
PutProvisionedConcurrencyConfig.title: To allocate provisioned concurrency

RemoveLayerVersionPermission.description: The following example deletes permission for an account to configure a layer version.
RemoveLayerVersionPermission.title: To delete layer-version permissions

RemovePermission.description: The following example removes a permissions statement named xaccount from the PROD alias of a function named my-function.
RemovePermission.title: To remove a Lambda function's permissions

TagResource.description: The following example adds a tag with the key name DEPARTMENT and a value of 'Department A' to the specified Lambda function.
TagResource.title: To add tags to an existing Lambda function

UntagResource.description: The following example removes the tag with the key name DEPARTMENT tag from the my-function Lambda function.
UntagResource.title: To remove tags from an existing Lambda function

UpdateAlias.description: The following example updates the alias named BLUE to send 30% of traffic to version 2 and 70% to version 1.
UpdateAlias.title: To update a function alias

UpdateEventSourceMapping.description: This operation updates a Lambda function event source mapping
UpdateEventSourceMapping.title: To update a Lambda function event source mapping

UpdateFunctionCode.description: The following example replaces the code of the unpublished ($LATEST) version of a function named my-function with the contents of the specified zip file in Amazon S3.
UpdateFunctionCode.title: To update a Lambda function's code

UpdateFunctionConfiguration.description: The following example modifies the memory size to be 256 MB for the unpublished ($LATEST) version of a function named my-function.
UpdateFunctionConfiguration.title: To update a Lambda function's configuration

UpdateFunctionEventInvokeConfig.description: The following example adds an on-failure destination to the existing asynchronous invocation configuration for a function named my-function.
UpdateFunctionEventInvokeConfig.title: To update an asynchronous invocation configuration
